questionText: How does a dirty windshield affect driving at night?
quesOptions: Having a dirty windshield helps to glare from oncoming traffic
Lights from oncoming traffic can hit it and create a glare
It helps deflect the light of oncoming traffic so it doesn't blind you
It causes bugs to stick more easily to the windshield and block your view
quesAnswer: Lights from oncoming traffic can hit it and create a glare

questionText: Your low beam headlights enable you to see ________ feet ahead and high Beam headlights ______ feet ahead at night
When an oncoming vehicle has their high beam headlights on at night, you should:
quesOptions: look at the white line on the right side of the road
look at the dotted line to the left side of the road
quesAnswer: look at the white line on the right side of the road

questionText: Visibility at night is limited. What action(s) can you take to ensure you are able to see as well as possible?
quesOptions: Turn on the dome light While you are driving
Keep the dome light Off you are driving. Dim the brightness Of your instrument panel. Check that all lights and reflectors are clean and in good working condition
quesAnswer: Keep the dome light Off you are driving. Dim the brightness Of your instrument panel. Check that all lights and reflectors are clean and in good working condition

questionText: What are some behaviors that may indicate an impaired driver?
quesOptions: A truck swerves suddenly to avoid an unmarked pothole
A sedan pulls to the side Of the road and turns on the four-way flashers
A car brakes hard to hitting a deer crossing the road
An SUV Weaves from lane to lane without using turn Signals
quesAnswer: An SUV Weaves from lane to lane without using turn Signals

questionText: What are some ways the exact same road may look completely different from day to night?
quesOptions: Pedestrians and bicyclists are more visible because they typically wear hivis clothing
Your headlights cannot bend around curves
Your headlights Can illuminate Over hills
Animals are generally sleeping so you see significantly less of them
quesAnswer: Your headlights cannot bend around curves

questionText: At night, how should you adjust your following distance?
quesOptions: Decrease it by at least seven seconds
Increase it by at one second
Decrease it by at least two seconds
Increase it by at least ten seconds
quesAnswer: Increase it by at one second

questionText: To ensure other drivers see you and your truck at night:
quesOptions: turn the dome light on to illuminate your Cab
keep your high beams on at all times
decrease your following distance so other drivers know you are behind them
use your tum signals for every turn or lane change so your intentions are always clear
quesAnswer: use your tum signals for every turn or lane change so your intentions are always clear

questionText: How is your vision different at night?
quesOptions: The sharpness Of itnages in front Of you increases
Your vision is no different at night
Visibility to the left and right sides becomes clearer
Your eyes struggle adjusting from light to dark or dark to light
quesAnswer: Your eyes struggle adjusting from light to dark or dark to light

questionText: Your eyes struggle adjusting from light to dark or dark to light
quesOptions: maintain a cab temperature Of 72-74 degrees
stop at regular intervals to rest or stretch

questionText: A road is __________ anyone who uses the road, while a road ________ is the state of the road surface
Traveling through a work zone can present which of the following challenges?
quesOptions: Traveling at higher limits, Wide lanes without any pedestrians
Confused drivers, narrow lanes, construction workers on or near the road
quesAnswer: Confused drivers, narrow lanes, construction workers on or near the road

questionText: What type of sign is posted in a work zone to give you advance warning of lane closings, construction areas, and workers ahead?
What speed limit should commercial motor vehicles (CMVs) drive when on an off-ramp?
quesOptions: CMVS Should travel at least 5 mph less than the ramp speed limit
CMVs should travel at 5 mph more than the ramp speed limit
CMV's should travel at the posted ramp speed limit
CMVs should travel at the same speed as the vehicle in form of them
quesAnswer: CMVS Should travel at least 5 mph less than the ramp speed limit

questionText: Which of the following are signs a parked vehicle might pull into traffic?
quesOptions: Exhaust is coming out of the tailpipe
The driver is looking over their Shoulder at traffic
There are people inside the car

questionText: If you see jacked-up wheels, a raised hood, or activated four-way flasher in the distance, what should you do to avoid the disabled vehicle?
quesOptions: Move one lane to maximize your space
You Should pull up behind the disabled vehicle to offer assistance
Take the nearest exit and get back on the highway a couple miles down the road
Put on your four-way flashers and Slowly pass the disabled vehicle On the right
quesAnswer: Move one lane to maximize your space

questionText: Which Of the following are signs a driver may be confused or impaired?
quesOptions: Tapping the brakes to down. Proper driving
Slowing or stopping suddenly and without warning. Erratic driving
quesAnswer: Slowing or stopping suddenly and without warning. Erratic driving

questionText: Which of the following actions can you take to identify hazards early?
quesOptions: Use your mirrors to scan behind and to the sides of your vehicle. Look 12-15 seconds ahead of your vehicle.
Maintain three seconds of space between your truck and the vehicle in from Of you
Tune your radio to a local channel to hear any hazard warnings

questionText: In addition to recognizing hazards, you should always _________ to avoid a crash
quesOptions: drive with your four-way flashers on
Speedup and swerve around confused drivers

questionText: If your escape route involves driving onto the shoulder, you need to be ready:
quesOptions: to set your down and maintain control
for the Change in road surface
quesAnswer: for the Change in road surface

questionText: If your fifth wheel isn't greased properly, it can:
Backing under your trailer at an angle can:
quesOptions: cause the ignition to Shut Off
push the trailer sideways or damage/break the landing gear
keep the airlines from getting pinched
quesAnswer: push the trailer sideways or damage/break the landing gear

questionText: If your service line is loose or damaged, you'll:
quesOptions: Suffer a serious leak When you apply the brakes

questionText: When performing the tug test, when should you stop?
quesOptions: When spotter gives you the proper hand signal
As soon as the trailer brakes pop out
AS soon as you feel resistance from the trailer
When you hear a squeak from your trailer tires
quesAnswer: AS soon as you feel resistance from the trailer

questionText: What is the safest way to lower and raise your trailer's landing gear in high gear?
quesOptions: Face the trailer spin the crank handle around your wrist
Face parallel to the trailer and use two hands
Face parallel to the trailer and rest one hand on the trailer
Face the trailer. keep your feet apart, and rest one hand on the trailer
quesAnswer: Face the trailer spin the crank handle around your wrist

questionText: HOW can you ease pressure on the fifth wheel locking jaws before uncoupling your tractor-trailer?
quesOptions: Lock the trailer brakes and back up gently
Park on a slight when possible
Turn the pintle hook at a 90 degree angle
quesAnswer: Lock the trailer brakes and back up gently

questionText: HOW can you pull the fifth wheel release handle in a way that doesn't put yourself at risk Of injury?
quesOptions: Pull on the handle with your dominant arm using a 2ig•zag pattern to the grip
Bend at the knees. keep your legs and feet Clear Of the rear tractor Wheels. square yourself up With the handle. and pull Straight out
Grasp the handle with both hands, brace your foot against the tires. and pull
Tuck you legs and feet between the rear tractor wheels to get better leverage
quesAnswer: Bend at the knees. keep your legs and feet Clear Of the rear tractor Wheels. square yourself up With the handle. and pull Straight out

questionText: When positioning the converter dolly for coupling, you should roll the converter dolly up to the front of the rear trailer and stop when:
quesOptions: the fifth wheel is fully under the trailer apron plate
the rear trailer kingpin is about a foot from the jaw opening
the fifth wheel makes Contact with the front Of the trailer apron plate
you hear the pintle hook snap into place
quesAnswer: the fifth wheel makes Contact with the front Of the trailer apron plate

questionText: When preparing to couple a rear trailer to a converter dolly, the trailer height should be _______ the center of the fifth wheel.
When uncoupling the converter dolly, why should you never unlock the pintle hook with the dolly under the rear trailer?
quesOptions: The dolly tow bar could fly up. possibly causing injury
You can unlock the pintle hook with the dolly under the rear trailer
The trailer could start to roll
quesAnswer: The dolly tow bar could fly up. possibly causing injury

questionText: In a manual transmission, the ______________ controls what gear the transmission is in
When your vehicle reaches the maximum speed for a gear, you must:
When double clutching is done correctly, and the RPMs are matched during the shift:
quesOptions: It helps you wait for the 500 RPM change before Changing gears
It gives you time to determine what gear comes next
It enables to get in a rhythm with the engine

questionText: Downshifting early is a common error that may:
quesOptions: Allow the engine to rev at IOW level, possibty causirvg the vehicle to Stall
Make it to get into the next lower gear
quesAnswer: Make it to get into the next lower gear

questionText: The purpose Of upshifting is to:
quesOptions: Allow the vehicle to increase speed
Transfer power from the transmission to the engine
Match road speed With engine power
quesAnswer: Allow the vehicle to increase speed

questionText: Proper, smooth shifting is important because if you shift before your vehicle is ready.
quesOptions: Your entire tractor-trailer may jerk forward
Your drive wheels may lock up momentarily
You could lose control of your vehicle

questionText: What actions negatively impact your vehicle's fuel economy?
quesOptions: Sitting in Of a gear (causes the motor to bog down)
using a heel-toe acceleration technique (causes the gears to Slip)
using double clutching (causes the RPMs to drop too low)
Downshifting too early (causes the RPMs to jump up)
quesAnswer: Downshifting too early (causes the RPMs to jump up)

questionText: With an autoshift transmission, if the transmission is in the drive position:
quesOptions: Only the low gears will automatically change
It will shift gears as needed based on speed and load
Only the top gears Will automatically change
You will use a button to control to Shift through all gears
quesAnswer: It will shift gears as needed based on speed and load

questionText: What is the primary difference between a manual and semiautomatic transmission?
quesOptions: The top gears automatically change in a semiautomatic transmission
The top gears automatically change in a manual transmission
A manual transmission uses electronic to help you shift
A semiautomatic transmission does not use a Clutch and gearshift lever
quesAnswer: The top gears automatically change in a semiautomatic transmission

questionText: What does an automatic transmission use to change gears?
If there is an imbalance Of ______________, a skid may occur
quesOptions: Traction, wheel load and force of motion
Wheel load. tread depth. and brake pressure
force Of 'notion. brake pressure. and tire inflation
quesAnswer: Traction, wheel load and force of motion

questionText: What are the most serious skids caused by?
What are the most common causes of a trailer jackknife?
A _________ will occur when the drive wheels attempt to take over the front wheels, causing the rear of the tractor to swing out :
What is something you can do to help prevent a front wheel skid?
quesOptions: Reduce your speed on wet or slippery pavement
Increase the pressure on your suspension system
Chain your tries in heavy rain
Reduce your drive tries inflation by 5-10 psi
quesAnswer: Reduce your speed on wet or slippery pavement

questionText: Traction is needed to maintain directional control. You need traction in order to:
quesOptions: Load, to Seen and be Seen

questionText: What should you do if your brakes fail?
quesOptions: Downshift and find an escape route
Hank your horn and flash your lights at all oncoming traffic
call 911 to have law enforcement clear the highway ahead
crank the wheel 180 degree and engage the emergency brakes
quesAnswer: Downshift and find an escape route

questionText: If you experience a tire blowout:
quesOptions: brake firmly to slow your vehicle

questionText: If your vehicle begins to hydroplane:
quesOptions: apply the brakes hard to come to a Stop as Soon as possible.
turn the wheel sharply to the right to guide the away from oncoming traffic
Speed up to increase the traction between your drive tries and the road
slow down until contact with the road surface is reestablished
quesAnswer: slow down until contact with the road surface is reestablished

questionText: What is one the main causes of vehicle rollovers?
quesOptions: Driving to slow on ramps curves and turns

questionText: Why is it important to be sure your fuel tank is topped off when adverse weather conditions are predicted?
quesOptions: It Can keep the electrical lines from becoming brittle and breaking easily
It can prevent carbon monoxide from leaking into your vehicle through the exhaust system
It can help ensure you do not run out of fuel and get stranded in a dangerous situation
It can help keep the appropriate ratio of fuel-to-oil in the fuel tank
quesAnswer: It can help ensure you do not run out of fuel and get stranded in a dangerous situation

questionText: What are some items you should have in your cab for your protection and safety when traveling during the winter months?
What measures can you take to help prevent heat-related illnesses?
quesOptions: Drink water frequently; avoid working in the direct sun; avoid heavy exertion
quesAnswer: Drink water frequently; avoid working in the direct sun; avoid heavy exertion

questionText: Tire chains are most effective on:
Tire chains placed on ________ improve traction for downhill braking
If your engine does not start, Stop cranking it after ___________ seconds and check for problems with the fuel tank/lines, electrical systems, and battery
The tree basic causes of skidding and jackknifing are:
quesOptions: black ice, fog, and heavy snow
dry powdery snow, rain, and high Winds

questionText: If your vehicle breaks down in cold, windy conditions, what can you do to keep yourself safe?
quesOptions: Stand outside to the right the vehicle. also you can walk to the nearest gas station for help.
Stay in the vehicle cab and put on extra clothing and stay warm
quesAnswer: Stay in the vehicle cab and put on extra clothing and stay warm

questionText: What primary factor(s) should help you determine what gear to select while traveling up steep grades?
quesOptions: The weight Of the load on the vehicle

questionText: When traveling on roads with sharp curves, how should you adjust your speed?
quesOptions: You should not travel on roads with Sharp Curves
Reduce your speed by at least 5-10 mph
Maintain a steady pace at the speed limit
quesAnswer: Reduce your speed by at least 5-10 mph

questionText: Why is proper space management so important?
quesOptions: You can use cruise control more, resulting in more efficient fuel economy
You'll remain calmer and more relaxed, helping to stay alert while driving
You will be able to make positional adjustments when unsafe conditions arise
You will draw less attention from law enforcement
quesAnswer: You will be able to make positional adjustments when unsafe conditions arise

questionText: If you're driving your 70-foot rig at 65 mph in good weather conditions and minimal traffic, you should leave ______ seconds between you and the car ahead Of you
If you're being tailgated, what are some actions you should take to Stay safe?
How can you ensure a cushion on either side Of your vehicle?
quesOptions: Don't hug the centerline in drift to the left
Travel alongside other vehicles as often as you can to ensure they see you at all times
Stay tight to the right side of the road to put as much distance between you and oncoming traffic
Honk your horn if you notice Another vehicle within 5 feet of the side of your vehicle
quesAnswer: Stay tight to the right side of the road to put as much distance between you and oncoming traffic

questionText: Minimum clearance distance for any overpasses you may encounter on your route is ___________ if your trailer is 13'6'' tall
How does a heavy load impact the clearance distance below your trailer?
quesOptions: It reduces the clearance distance below
It increases the clearance distance below
It does not impact the clearance distance below your trailer
It reduces the clearance distance in the back but increases it in the front
quesAnswer: It reduces the clearance distance below

questionText: When you are making a right turn, _________ before starting the turn.
quesOptions: Stop for at least Seven seconds
Pull your tractor-traitor Straight into the intersection
quesAnswer: Pull your tractor-traitor Straight into the intersection

questionText: If there are two lanes available for a left turn:
quesOptions: make Sure you've reached the Center Of the intersection before Starting the turn
always take the lane furthest to the right

questionText: Which of the following signs might indicate a distracted driver?
quesOptions: Reducing their speed dramatically to avoid with other vehicles
Changing their speed erratically for no apparent reason
providing adequate space ahead and behind their vehicle fat merging traffic
Maintaining their position in a single lane for an extended period of time
quesAnswer: Changing their speed erratically for no apparent reason

questionText: If you encounter a distracted driver who is on their handheld cell phone, what are some actions you can take to ensure your own safety?
quesOptions: Move to the right (if you earl safely) to encourage the driver to pass you
Flash your headlights or tap your brake lights to got their attention
Attempt to make eye contact and motion for them to hang up the phone
Hank your horn (electric to get their attention or air horn to warn them of danger)
quesAnswer: Move to the right (if you earl safely) to encourage the driver to pass you

questionText: Your ___________ is the distance a vehicle travels from the time you see a hazard until your brain recognizes it
A CMV's components (brakes, tires, springs, etc.) are designed to work best when:
quesOptions: traveling through Curves and on grades

questionText: How does traveling at higher speeds affect your CMV's total stopping distance?
quesOptions: It decreases your total stopping distance
It increases your brake lag distance

questionText: You should slow to at least mph below the posted speed limit when entering a curve
On a downgrade, your vehicle is working _______________  gravity, resulting in a(n) ____________ in speed
What danger(s) can foreign objects in the road pose?
quesOptions: They get caught between dual tires
They can cause damage to electrical and brake lines
They can be a danger to your tires and wheel rims

questionText: What two factors are affected most by extreme weather conditions?
If you unable to maintain a safe following distance when driving in heavy traffic, it's best to travel _________ surrounding vehicles
What is the result Of two or more convictions Of excessive speeding (15 mph over the speed limit)?
quesOptions: You will be disqualified for 60-120 days
You can incur potential fines and higher premiums
It will appear in your permanent diving record
If at least one of the convictions in in your personal vehicle, nothing will happen

questionText: It is acceptable to use your cruise control:
quesOptions: When driving at night or in adverse weather Conditions
When conditions are ideal, and only if your carrier allows it
during rush hour, when in heavy traffic, or while on congested highways
when you are tired or fatigued
quesAnswer: When conditions are ideal, and only if your carrier allows it

questionText: Visual distractions are:
quesOptions: only a problem for the people Who are not professional drivers
those that occur only immediately on the road in front of you
those that lure your eyes away from the road
a type of distraction that you should focus your attention on while driving
quesAnswer: those that lure your eyes away from the road

questionText: An example of a _________ distraction is eating a cheeseburger and fries while driving down the road
What is it called when you actually don't 'see' something, even though it's right there in your line of sight?
Which Of the following statements is true about texting while driving?
quesOptions: Texting is allowable if you limit your answers to one word
Texting is almost as dangerous as talking on a cell phone
Texting only a by allowed by commercial motor vehicle drivers
The effects Of texting while driving are the same as being intoxicated
quesAnswer: The effects Of texting while driving are the same as being intoxicated

questionText: According to the FMCSA, which Of the following actions ma be permissible when driving a CMV?
quesOptions: Dialing a number while at an intersection
Answering a hands-free cell-phone by touching a single button
Holding a cell phone in one hand
Reaching for your phone to Check a message
quesAnswer: Answering a hands-free cell-phone by touching a single button

questionText: Keeping both hands on the wheel in the ________  position will enable you to respond quickly to potential hazards, including distracted drivers
If you can't ignore a distraction, what should you do?
quesOptions: Take care of it at your next planned Stop or pull over
Take no more than five seconds to  handle it (tune radio, answer text, etc.) while driving
If know you're getting an emergency call, you can go ahead and take it
quesAnswer: Take care of it at your next planned Stop or pull over

questionText: Which Of the following are signs another driver is distracted?
quesOptions: His or her vehicle is moving faster Or slower than other traffic
The driver is tailgating Other vehicles
The driver is ma king dramatic changes in speed for no apparent reason

questionText: What is the best way to deal with a distracted driver?
quesOptions: Ignore the distracted driver and focus on the road in front Of you
pull in front of the distracted driver
Lessen the distance between you and the distracted driver
Create a safety cushion between you and the distracted driver
quesAnswer: Create a safety cushion between you and the distracted driver

questionText: You can help reduce distracted driving by: committing to not drive while you're distracted, watching out for distracted drivers around you, and:
quesOptions: recording the actions of other distracted drivers on the road
relaxing when behind the wheel with deep breaths
Responding by managing distracted drivers once you spot them
reporting the actions Of distracted in your area to the FMCSA
quesAnswer: Responding by managing distracted drivers once you spot them

questionText: Using your turn signals is optional when:
quesOptions: returning to your lane after passing another vehicle
merging into the of traffic under 25mph
Changing lanes when no one else is around

questionText: On the highway, you should signal about ____________ feet before turning
If traffic ahead begins to slow, what should you do to alert those around you that you're slowing down?
What can happen if you attempt to direct traffic by flashing your lights, blowing your horn, or using hand signals?
quesOptions: You create a safer environment around your entire tractor-trailer
You can be found at fault for the mistake of someone else or it could cause an accident resulting in injury, damage. and potential liability
You are only allowed to direct traffic if you wear a bright vest
quesAnswer: You can be found at fault for the mistake of someone else or it could cause an accident resulting in injury, damage. and potential liability

questionText: When approaching a pedestrian or bicyclist, always assume:
quesOptions: they are aware Of your presence
you have the right Of Way
There are more pedestrian/bicyclists with them you cannot see
they do not See you and could Suddenly move in front Of vehicle
quesAnswer: they do not See you and could Suddenly move in front Of vehicle

questionText: From dusk to dawn, be sure your ___________are always turned on.
Which horn should you use when trying to communicate with others?
When is an appropriate time for you to use your four-way flashers?
quesOptions: When coming to a Complete Stop on a "roadway or its Shoulder Or when slowing down unexpectedly"
At all crosswalks that are occupied by pedestrians
quesAnswer: When coming to a Complete Stop on a "roadway or its Shoulder Or when slowing down unexpectedly"

questionText: According to the FMCSRS, if you vehicle is stopped, you have __________ minutes to set out your emergency warning devices
HOW can making eye contact help you communicate with others around you?
quesOptions: It can enable you maintain full Control over your vehicle
It can help enforce Who has the right Of way
It can assist in confirming others awareness of your presence
Trying to make is distracting and never a good idea while driving
quesAnswer: It can assist in confirming others awareness of your presence

questionText: Distance scanning helps you:
As a general rule, look about _________ ahead of your vehicle
How often should you check your mirrors while driving?
Which Of the following are potential hazards you must be aware of while driving?
Which Of the following scenarios could indicate a distracted pedestrian?
quesOptions: Someone looking both ways before entering a crosswalk
Someone looking down while reading text on a cell phone
Someone looking Straight ahead at oncoming traffic
Someone making eye contact With you as you approach
quesAnswer: Someone looking down while reading text on a cell phone

questionText: What is a potential sign Of a distracted driver?
quesOptions: The truck behind you is Slowing down to make a right turn
The SUV behind Cut Off another driver and is now swerving and tailgating you
The truck in front Of you Stays in its lane and maintains a consistent speed
The car in front of you has its cruise control set and maintains a consistent speed
quesAnswer: The SUV behind Cut Off another driver and is now swerving and tailgating you

questionText: Which type of mirror is designed to eliminate as much Of your blind spot as possible?
If you need to see down the sides and towards the rear of your trailer, what mirror should you use?
When adjusting your mirrors, what should you See in the inside vertical edge of your plane (west coast) mirrors?
quesOptions: A point on the ground 35 feet away
A point on the ground 30 feet away

questionText: When changing lanes, check your mirrors:
quesOptions: after you signal and as you begin the lane change
after you complete the lane change

questionText: How does your trailer respond when you turn the wheel to the right while backing?
quesOptions: You Should never turn Wheel While backing

questionText: What is a key reason backing is so dangerous?
quesOptions: Backing tends to cause damage to accelerators
Backing gives limited visibility, you will always have a blind spot
Backing requires you get out of your tractor; you Could by another vehicle
Sticking you head Out the Window Can lead to Chronic neck and back pain
quesAnswer: Backing gives limited visibility, you will always have a blind spot

questionText: What is the acronym commonly used to remember the safety check you should perform before backing?
quesOptions: LAYER: Look Around Your Entire Rig

questionText: If you can use a spotter when backing:
quesOptions: Responsibility for any incidents that occur transfers to the Spotter
You must agree on all hand signals before beginning the maneuver
Using a handbell cell phone to communicate With him/her is best
He/She Should be behind your vehicle at all times
quesAnswer: You must agree on all hand signals before beginning the maneuver

questionText: Which of the backing techniques is fundamental in learning all other backing maneuvers?
What is the key characteristic to the alley dock backing maneuver?
quesOptions: Backing for a long distance (over 200 feet)
Backing into a space alongside a dock
Backing while turning into a space that is 90 degrees to the truck
quesAnswer: Backing while turning into a space that is 90 degrees to the truck

questionText: Which Of the following statements regarding blind-side jackknife backing are true?
quesOptions: Your spotter should be visible at least 25 percent Of the time
Ending up with a greater than 90-degree angle is preferred
It is best to Stop every feet to Check your clearance or use the assistance of a spotter. if possible
quesAnswer: It is best to Stop every feet to Check your clearance or use the assistance of a spotter. if possible

questionText: What backing maneuver should you use if the trailer did not wind up directly in front of the target?
What is something typically unique to loading dock areas you must watch out for when backing?
quesOptions: unusual clearances around the dock and any nearby barriers
quesAnswer: unusual clearances around the dock and any nearby barriers

questionText: When backing in a parking lot, take note of the:
quesOptions: Amount of fuel in your tank
position of the entrances and exits
Location Of the sun in the Sky relative to your mirrors
quesAnswer: position of the entrances and exits

questionText: What is the very first step you should take when starting a tractor-trailer engine?
What is the appropriate cool down period for the tractor-trailer engine?
quesOptions: A cool period is not necessary
It depends on the weather (temperature and humidity)
It based on the engine-type, nature of the trip, and cargo hauled
quesAnswer: It based on the engine-type, nature of the trip, and cargo hauled

questionText: When setting your tractor-trailer in motion, how can you tell the friction point of your clutch has been reached?
quesOptions: The friction point light will flash
Your RPMs remain the same for a full 5 seconds

questionText: After stopping your tractor-trailer:
quesOptions: Pump the brakes to Charge the air tanks
Maintain enough brake pressure to keep the vehicle stationary
quesAnswer: Maintain enough brake pressure to keep the vehicle stationary

questionText: When testing your tractor-trailer hook-up, pull gently against the locked trailer brakes and stop when:
quesOptions: Your tractor does not move for at least 5 seconds
Your trailer brake button pops out
You feel the engine start to drag down
quesAnswer: You feel the engine start to drag down

questionText: What should you do if you are unsure what may be behind your vehicle while backing?
quesOptions: Inform everyone in the Vicinity that will be hacking up and they out Of your Way
Stick your head the window and back during entire maneuver
Check your mirrors and quickly anything can your path
Stop get out Of vehicle, and Check your path
quesAnswer: Stop get out Of vehicle, and Check your path

questionText: What should you do if you cannot easily Correct trailer drift (your vehicle is too far out Of position) when backing your vehicle?
quesOptions: Pull up, the trailer, and Start over
Find Someone to back vehicle for you
Turn the tractor around and watch both mirrors
Get a qualified to help you get back on path
quesAnswer: Pull up, the trailer, and Start over

questionText: What is off-tracking?
quesOptions: When the rear Wheels Of a trailer lock up, causing the trailer to swing around
When the rear Wheels follow a different path than the front wheels while making a turn
When the wheels of a tractor lose traction and the vehicle off the road
The amplification of side-to-side through the rear of the trailer
quesAnswer: When the rear Wheels follow a different path than the front wheels while making a turn

questionText: What is essential for you to do when you're making a left turn in an intersection with multiple lanes?
quesOptions: Speed up before you make the turn
Begin turning as soon as your cab passes the crosswalk
Signal no more than 50 feet in advance

questionText: What factors will determine how much time is needed to get your vehicle up to speed to safely merge with oncoming traffic on an interstate?
In order to put a commercial motor vehicle on the road, you must first:
quesOptions: Ask a mechanic about the vehicle's condition
Perform a Short test drive to verify safe operation
Conduct a thorough pre-trip inspect ion
quesAnswer: Conduct a thorough pre-trip inspect ion

questionText: Before you inspect the engine compartment and front axle components:
quesOptions: Remove the chocks from the wheels
Verify the parking brakes have been set
Put the vehicle keys in the ignition, depress the clutch, and start the engine
quesAnswer: Verify the parking brakes have been set

questionText: What is the minimum tread depth for the steer-tire?
When inspecting the brake assembly, you should ensure:
quesOptions: The slack adjusters are snug and tight
The brake Shoes have at least a quarter-inch lining
Crease is dripping no faster than one drop per minute from the brake drum or pads
Air lines have more than four cracks
quesAnswer: The brake Shoes have at least a quarter-inch lining

questionText: After the initial 50-mile check, how often must you conduct additional on-the-road inspections Of the cargo securement and securement devices?
quesOptions: Each time you stop to refuel
Whenever a change of duty status is made, every three hours, or I5O , whichever comes first
Whenever you Stop for fuel or every I5O miles, whichnever comes first
If you are Stopped for a roadside inspection and tail
quesAnswer: Whenever a change of duty status is made, every three hours, or I5O , whichever comes first

questionText: What are the only circumstances you are not required to inspect your cargo and load securing devices?
quesOptions: 1.if your load is sealed and you have been ordered not to open it
2.If your destination is less than 100 — air miles from your home terminal
3.If your vehicle is loaded in a Way that makes Cargo inspection impossible

questionText: When is it appropriate to conduct a post- trip inspection?
quesOptions: The same exact time every evening, regardless of where you are
At the end of every work day
Right before 12 midnight, when your next day begins on your driver's daily log
Whenever it's most convenient, but before the start of next day

questionText: If the previous driver found defects and noted them on a DVIR, what must you do before operating that vehicle again?

quesAnswer: Ensure that any items listed defective/deficient that may affect the safe operation Of the vehicle Were repaired

questionText: Victims Of human trafficking may:
quesOptions: appear to under the drugs or alcohol

questionText: Body language can indicate a person is a victim Of trafficking. Which of the following would raise a red flag?
quesOptions: Someone Who is not Very familiar With politics
A person who appears fearful or submissive
A Very outgoing and talkative person
quesAnswer: A person who appears fearful or submissive

questionText: Which of the following questions will help you determine if someone you are speaking with is a possible human trafficking victim?
quesOptions: Do you know where you are right now?
quesAnswer: Do you know where you are right now?

questionText: When contacting authorities, which information should you provide?
quesOptions: Address description or location, Time and date, Detailed description Of any vehicles Or people involved.
A list of possible outcomes if they don't
quesAnswer: A list of possible outcomes if they don't

questionText: What number do you call to report possible human trafficking to federal law
CSA is a driver and carrier monitoring and evaluation system that is designed to:
quesOptions: rate drivers and on a daily basis
identify and intervene with drivers and carriers who are not in compliance with safety regulations
recognize the safe actions Of drivers
keep track Of the Current location Of every CMV on the road
quesAnswer: identify and intervene with drivers and carriers who are not in compliance with safety regulations

questionText: Data collection, safety measurement, safety evaluation, and intervention are:
quesOptions: statistical tools used to monitor drivers
categories Of violations a carrier can be given
major components Of the CSA system
quesAnswer: major components Of the CSA system

questionText: CSA data is collected from which of the following sources?
quesOptions: Driver job applications. phone calls' data
Law enforcement crash reports. Roadside inspections. FMCSA investigations
quesAnswer: Law enforcement crash reports. Roadside inspections. FMCSA investigations

questionText: Which of the following violations fall under the unsafe Driving Basic?
quesOptions: Driving after dark Without special permission
Driving for too many hours in one day
Driving too close behind the vehicle ahead of you.
quesAnswer: Driving too close behind the vehicle ahead of you.

questionText: The Hours-of-Service Compliance BASIC includes an out-of-service penalty. What other BASIC includes this penalty?
You are loading a standard double with 20,000 pounds of cargo. Which of the following is the best way to distribute the weight between the two trailers?
quesOptions: 10,000 lbs. on lead trailer. 10.000 lbs. on rear
18,000 lbs. on lead trailer. 2.000 lbs. on rear
11,000 lbs. on lead trailer. 9000 on rear
5,000 lbs. on lead trailer, 15.000 lbs. on rear
quesAnswer: 11,000 lbs. on lead trailer. 9000 on rear

questionText: What is one maneuver you should never attempt while pulling triples?
quesOptions: Backing into a loading dock area
Driving down a grade of 15 degrees or more
quesAnswer: Backing into a loading dock area

questionText: Which of the following statements about oversized vehicles is true?
quesOptions: You do not need a special to an oversized vehicle. Oversized vehicle are restricted highways that is actually depends on cargo type.
Requirements on type Of cargo, size, weight and state regulations. vehicles are restricted to designated highways.
quesAnswer: Requirements on type Of cargo, size, weight and state regulations. vehicles are restricted to designated highways.

questionText: What type of cargo are low-clearance vehicles designed to haul?
quesOptions: Loads With a high center-of-gravity. Loads that contain liquids
Creator cubic capacity loads. Heavy. oversized cargo
quesAnswer: Creator cubic capacity loads. Heavy. oversized cargo

questionText: For vehicles with a high center Of gravity, how should the heaviest cargo be loaded for improved handling?
quesOptions: High in the trailer and toward the back
Low in the trailer and toward the front
High in the trailer and toward the front
Low in the trailer and toward the back
quesAnswer: Low in the trailer and toward the front

questionText: To enter the country, Canada requires:
quesOptions: you to become a Canadian citizen
no felony convictions for the prior ten years

questionText: Which of the following personal items must you declare at the Canadian border?
In Canada, professional drivers are prohibited from having _____ in the cab of their vehicle under any circumstances
Before leaving for Canada, you need to ensure your vehicle registration, applicable safety certificates, fuel tax registration, and ______ are all in order
Which lanes should you use as you approach entry to the border station?
quesOptions: Always take the lane with the shortest line

questionText: Why are rolling costs difficult to predict?
quesOptions: Sometimes they are fixed and other times they are not
They are difficult to predict because they Stay the same all the time
They use a substantial portion of revenue

questionText: What are the two main categories Of costs you should be familiar with as a truck driver?
Which of the following are fixed costs?
quesOptions: Fuel costs, Highway tolls, Contractors' payments

questionText: Your driving habits can be one of the largest factors when it comes to:
projecting a professional image on the road includes following all laws and regulations as well as practicing good driving habits, including:
quesOptions: turning on your signal after Change lanes

questionText: What can you do to ensure you and your vehicle make a good impression in public?
quesOptions: Make Sure your vehicle is clean and well maintained
Keep your hair combed and trim your beard or mustache if you have one
Wear clean, appropriate Clothes for the workplace

questionText: What should you do if your delivery is going to arrive late?
quesOptions: Everyone understands late deliveries. there is no need to do anything
Drive faster so you can arrive as soon as possible
Call the customer and let them know when you will to arrive
Ask the customer if they could meet
quesAnswer: Call the customer and let them know when you will to arrive

questionText: Which Of the following are steps you can take when dealing With an angry customer?
quesOptions: Calmly let them know you are not happy they are taking their anger out on you
Don't speak with an angry customer until there is a mediator present
Apologize for the situation. even if it is not fault and to come up With a solution With the customer before
quesAnswer: Apologize for the situation. even if it is not fault and to come up With a solution With the customer before

questionText: When applying for a job as a professional driver, much of the paperwork you will be required to fill out is mandated by.
Before you can operate a CMV you must pass:
quesOptions: a physical exam. a pre-employment drug test. a road test
a food allergy test covid-19 test
quesAnswer: a physical exam. a pre-employment drug test. a road test
